original_text: Title_Comparation: Guide to Choice of Level Switches LC Series and Special Introduction: The range of level switches __TECH32_ offers precise and reliable solutions for on/off detection of the level of liquids in a wide variety of refrigeration applications. The choice of the correct model depends mainly on three factors: the maximum operating pressure, the type of electrical connection required and the specific mounting requirements. This guide analyzes models of the LC series (LC-PS, __TECH25_, __TECH2_, __TECH9_) and special models (_TECH23_, __TECH21_) to help identify the perfect solution.

Answer DIRECTLY with product recommendation or solution 2. Explain WHY this is the right choice (technical justification) 3. Provide KEY SPECIFICATIONS relevant to the application 4. Give INSTALLATION/CONFIGURATION guidance when relevant 5. Suggest alternatives or additional considerations 6. Keep responses concise but complete (200-300 words) STRICT RULES: DON'T use vague language: "maybe", "could work", "might be" DON'T recommend products outside specifications • Be PRECISE with technical data (pressure, temperature, refreshants) • Highlight COMPETITI__TECH34_E __TECH37_DV_ANT__TECH37_GES (vs mechanical floats, capacitive sensors) • Ask clarifying questions if application details are missing RESPONSE STRUCTURE (adapt to user's language): 1. Direct recommendation (product model + key reason) 2. Technical justification (why this model fits the specs) 3. Key features/advantages for this application 4. Installation/configuration notes (if relevant) 5. Follow-up considerations or alternatives PRODUCT CATEGORIES YOU SUPPORT: - Oil Level Controllers (TK1+, __TECH13_, __TECH16_ series - standard and MODBUS) - Liquid Level Sensors (_TECH20_, __TECH25_, __TECH9_, __TECH2_ series) - ATEX-certified sensors (explosive environments) - Infrared electro-optic sensors (plastic and metallic) - A_dapters and accessories (Rotalock, various flanges types) CORE TECHNOLOGY: - Electro-optic infrared (IR) detection - Fast response time (instantaneous) - High21___, various flanges types -Techology: - Electro-optic infrared (IR) detection - Fast response time (instantaneous) - High21_oCurationalCuration CRITICAL REMINDER: Response ONLY in the user's question language. Provides accurate technical specifications. No exceptions.

Complete technical text: title_comparation: Guide to the Choice of Level Switches LC Series and Special Introduction: The range of level switches __TECH32_ offers precise and reliable solutions for the on/off detection of the level of liquids in a wide variety of refrigeration applications. The choice of the correct model depends mainly on three factors: the maximum operating pressure, the type of electrical connection required and the specific mounting requirements. This guide analyzes models of the LC series (LC-PS, __TECH25_, __TECH2_, __TECH9_) and special models (_TECH23_, __TECH21_) to help identify the perfect solution. --- Question: Which refrigerants are compatible with LC-PS? Response as an expert Teklab technical sales assistant: - Provide accurate technical specifications - Explain product features and applications clearly - Give installation and configuration guidance - Focus on PRACTICAL IMPLEMENTATION and compatibility - Cite pressure ranges, temperatures, certificates when relevant
The LC-PS model is suitable for use in refrigeration applications, such as compressors and evaporaters.

metadata.chunk_title: Guida alla Scelta degli Interruttori di Livello Serie LC e Speciali
iconic_quotes: The choice of the correct model depends mainly on three factors: the maximum operating pressure, the type of electrical connection required, and the specific mounting requirements.
This guide analyzes the models of the LC series (LC-PS, LC-PH, LC-XT, LC-XP) and special models (TK1+, Rotalock) to help identify the perfect solution.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between LC-PS and LC-PH?
qa_pairs.answer: LC-PS supports up to 46 bar and is ideal for standard HFC/HFO systems, while LC-PH supports up to 120 bar and is specifically designed for high-pressure transcritical CO2 systems. Both use cable connection, but LC-PH also has M12 connector option.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between LC-PS and LC-PH?
qa_pairs.answer: LC-PS supports up to 46 bar and is ideal for standard HFC/HFO systems, while LC-PH supports up to 120 bar and is specifically designed for high-pressure transcritical CO2 systems. Both use cable connection, but LC-PH also has an optional M12 connector.

qa_pairs.question: When to choose LC-XT instead of LC-PS?
qa_pairs.answer: Choose LC-XT when you need the same pressure capacity as LC-PS (46 bar) but prefer an industrial DIN connector instead of direct cable. This facilitates maintenance and quick replacement, ideal for OEMs and modular plants where intervention speed is a priority.

qa_pairs.question: What is the maximum pressure range supported by TK3+?
qa_pairs.answer: The TK3+ model supports a maximum operating pressure of 130 bar. It is important to check the product specifications to determine if it is suitable for your needs.

qa_pairs.question: Which refrigerants are compatible with LC-PS?
qa_pairs.answer: LC-PS models are compatible with the following refrigerants: R134a, R404A, CO2. It is important to check the product specifications to determine compatibility with your system.

qa_pairs.question: How do I select between TK3+ and TK4?
qa_pairs.answer: The choice between TK3+ and TK4 depends on your specific needs. The TK3+ model supports a maximum operating pressure of 130 bar, while the TK4 model supports a maximum operating pressure of 80 bar. It is important to check the product specifications to determine which is suitable for your needs.
